summary:
The 1900 Galveston hurricane was a deadly and powerful storm in U.S. history. It hit Galveston, Texas, causing massive destruction. The storm brought strong winds and a huge storm surge, leading to between 6,000 and 12,000 deaths, with 8,000 being the official count. It destroyed thousands of buildings and left many people homeless. This disaster changed Galveston, ending its golden era.

The hurricane started in the Atlantic, gaining strength as it moved west. It hit the Dominican Republic, Cuba, and then the Gulf of Mexico, becoming a Category 4 hurricane. It made landfall near Houston, causing damage across Texas and other states. Its remnants also affected Canada, causing deaths and destruction.
title: 1900 Galveston hurricane
